result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Gamez Garza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:10 am [Case was scheduled for initial appearance]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Yelena O Zarwell in court. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell: Do not have any information about the non-appearance of Defendant
ADA SHock: Sheriff attempted to locate the Defendant, but was unable. Request the Court issue warrant
Court finds probable cause, presents basis and orders issuance of warrant, revokes bond

Case called at 10:49 am [Cases were scheduled for initial appearance]
Defendant Miguel A Gamez Garza not in court. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall: Is case where Defendant was released on a signature bond after having been in custody; complaint was then filed. Request the Court adjourn for personal service.
Court grants and adjourns for personal service

case called at 1:29pm. 
Defendant Miguel Angel Gamez Garza (dob 07/05/1987) appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD appears for bond purposes only; Attorney Zarwell indicates that the early-eligibility determination is that Mr. Gamez Garza will qualify for PD representation).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Garza verifies that he has received a copy of the Probable Cause Statement, and that the date of birth on the Probable Cause Statement form is correct.  
Attorney Flint indicates that the State is seeking thirty days to file a Criminal Complaint.
The Court confirms its Probable Cause finding. 

The Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with D.G. (dob 2/21/03), or with the immediate family of D.G. including siblings and parents
--no presence at D.G.'s residence
--no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
The Court designates that this Bond shall lapse in thirty days if no Criminal Complaint is filed.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 1:34pm.
